pullRequest.title: Add a utility class for parsing GeoJson
pullRequest.bodyText:
To download tiles based on Offline Imagery selections, we need to parse geojson files for tile specifications (polygons) and determine which tiles in a given geojson file intersect with the bounds of an offline imagery selection. This utility class handles both requirements.
This PR also contains changes to the Tile model--we need to update our approach to modeling tiles now that we download them by regional intersection instead of direct selection.

commit.message:
Update Tile model

I've added four fields to the tile model:

- URL: A valid url that store the tile's corresponding imagery.
- X: X coordinate of the tile.
- Y: Y coordinate of the tile.
- Z: Z coordinate of the tile.

This change also includes necessary changes to the TileEntity and File
download worker that result from the model changes listed above. I've
also updated some doc comments to make them more consistent with other
comments throughout the codebase.

Add a GeoJsonParser utility class

This class handles translating GeoJson to and from the model entities
we're interested in--at the moment, just tiles. It also implements a
method to get all the tiles specified in a GeoJson that intersect with a
particular bounds (we'll use this to download tiles based on offline
imagery selections).
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/google/ground-android into json-parser

nodes.bodyText: This is wrong -.- Have to fix this.
Would getFilenameFromCoords() be more appropriate?
Nit: maybe -> Maybe
What if the tile has been deleted since this job was queued? Maybe we shouldn't fail but just exit?

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' into json-parser

Refactor JSON geometry methods, return the immutable list of tiles

This change moves two checks for appropriate geojson features into the
GeoJsonTile class, and refactors the tile constructor into several
supporting methods.

Any fields that are requried to specify a tile throw exceptions on their
absence--this way we can debug and diagnose issues in the JSON itself,
as well as potentially inform users of issues in their own JSON later.

We also now actually return the list of constructed tiles form the
parser.
Merge branch 'json-parser' of https://github.com/scolsen/ground-android into json-parser
Fix typo, maybe -> Maybe
Rename pathFromCoords -> filenameFromCoords in Tile

nodes.bodyText:
Java auto converts int when using + with Strings, e.g:
String filename = z + "-" + x + "-" y;
=> getTileUrl(..)?
Please move field names into String constants.
Since you're throwing a checked exception, the caller will need to handle it, in which case the catch() and Log statements aren't needed here.

A few suggestions on code structure:

 This deals with deserializing JSON files, so it probably in the persistence package. (e.g. ...persistence.geojson?)
 Rather than pass JSONObject around to static methods, can we wrap the different instances in typed accessor objects? (e.g., JsonGeometry, JsonTileExtent, etc)? (https://testing.googleblog.com/2017/11/obsessed-with-primitives.html)
 If this file is  moved to its own package, the inner classes and be promoted to outer classes in their own file to help readability.
 GeoJsonParser can then provide a custom GeoJson object with the data we're interested in.

Wdyt?

I don't feel smart enough to consider all the interactions between the workers and managers, so as a defensive maneuver would normally try to make everything idempotent that can be. Besides the user deleting the tile, it could also get remove if the user clears the app cache; I'm not sure if workers get cancelled as well when that happens. Even if they do, it would be nice not to need to know whether that's the case. Perhaps we can just bail out and log a debug log message instead?

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' into json-parser

Refactor geo json parsing utility

This commit refactors our approach to geo JSON parsing, including:

- Moving the parser into its own package under persistance
- Creating classes to represent each peice of JSON data we need
- Using constants to refer to JSON key names
- Healthy use of optionals to avoid non-catastrophic exceptions
- Simplifying the parser class itself

I've also replaced the cartesian coordinates based path conversion in
Tiles with the original id based-approach, since it's simpler for the
time being.
Merge branch 'json-parser' of https://github.com/scolsen/ground-android into json-parser
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/google/ground-android into json-parser

nodes.bodyText: Consider using List instead. Also, an empty list is synonymous with Optional.empty(), so Optional isn't needed here.
Consider renaming to vertices.
Extracting the coordinates from the geometry seems to be almost free, so we should prefer to remove this derived state and calculate when called.
this is only needed in the constructor to disambiguate the field name from the constructor arg, please remove throughout.
get() with throw an exception if the Optional is empty. We should either check .isPresent() first, use functional methods to propagate the empty state, or avoid the Optional altogether.
This could then become Arrays.asList(new LatLng(..), new LatLng(..)..)
Same comment here - let's get these states on the fly rather than caching them since it adds carrying cost without adding performance [possible overoptimization].
Please make these classes package private (i.e. class GeoJsonGeometry) to avoid accidental usage outside this package and to signal they're tightly coupled to the parser.

nodes.bodyText: Please move down to after the public method that depends on it or after all public methods.
Please use System.lineSeparator() instead of \n.
The arg name geojson collides with bar geoJson. Perhaps rename to file for clarity?
Either use orElse() to provide a default here and below, make required (not Optional), or check these fields are present before hand to prevent get() from crashing the app.
Same here re cached state.

nodes.bodyText: Can we split the loading of the file into a String into a separate method so that this method will focus on  parsing its contents?

commit.message:
Improve code quality of GeoJsonExtents

Including:

- Use an ImmutableList instead of an Array to represent vertices
- Rename instances of coordinates to vertices
- Calculate vertices on demand instead of allocating
- Check that optionals aren't empty before calling `get()`
- Reorder LatLngs in vertices list
- Make various methods/classes package private

Improve code quality in GeoJsonGeometry

Notably:

- Make the class package private
- Calculate JSON field values on demand, instead of allocating

Improve code quality in GeoJsonParser

- Move static methods below public ones
- Split JSON file reading into a separate function
- Read files character by character instead of line by line
- Return empty strings when URL and ID fields aren't present in JSON
  tiles.
Compute GeoJsonTile values on demand instead of caching

nodes.bodyText: Can we get rid of this method and expose or rename getPolygonVertices()
Instead of eating the exception and returning "", we can throw it and catch it in intersectingTiles, eliminating the need for a "fake" value in the interim.
These two lines can be combined.
Ideally we wouldn't keep Tile in an invalidate state if the file is invalid. Could you add a TODO here to throw an Exception instead that gets handled downstream?

This will return Optional.of("") if it doesn't exists. We should either model missing as null, Optional.empty(), or "". Any of those alternatives are fine, but all these will make edge cases harder to catch.

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/google/ground-android into json-parser

Remove redundant getter method in GeoJsonExtent

getPolygonVertices and getVertices were redundant--this change renames
the PolygonVertices method to getVertices and exposes it to callers
directly (package-private).

Improve code quality in GeoJsonParser

- Be terse; merge equivalent lines.
- Throw exceptions where it makes sense.
- Add a TODO to throw further exceptions later.

Remove cartesian coordinates from Tile model/db entity

YAGNI/KISS--we don't have reason to store these yet, and accessing tiles
by path/id alone was sufficient in the past. We can revisit storing
these values if we need to in the future.
Return Optional.empty on empty ID values in JSONTile

nodes.bodyText: If you're throwing the exception callers will need to catch it, and they will try to log it as well; in that case no need for the try/catch and Log,
This error message is slightly misleading "Ignoring Error in JSON" might be more accurate.

When an exception is thrown here result[i] will remain uninitialized (null). In this case you'd need to filter them out in the caller intersectingTiles(). A cleaner/simpler approach would be to add them to an ArrayList instead of a primitive array.

commit.message:
Use ArrayList instead of Array to avoid nulls

Prior to this, malformed JSON objects encountered by the toArray method
would result in nasty nulls. We now use ArrayList to avoid breaking our
stream over these values later.

I also removed an extraneous try/catch.
Merge branch 'master' into json-parser

Address PMD issues

- Use List interface instead of ArrayList directly.
- Remove unused import.
